title: Rizogalo (Greek Rice Pudding) Recipe
description: Greek rice pudding is a simple, comforting, and delicious dessert. Some Greek versions make rizogalo with eggs, but this is an egg-free version.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European Greek Rizogalo (Greek Rice Pudding) 4.6 (12) 11 Reviews 6 Photos Greek rice pudding is simple, comforting, and delicious. Some people in Greece make it with eggs, but my aunt prefers it without. It's best enjoyed cold — if you can wait that long! Submitted by Diana Moutsopoulos Updated on May 12, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 40 mins Additional Time: 4 hrs 30 mins Total Time: 5 hrs 15 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 cups water ½ cup uncooked short-grain white rice 2 1/2 cups whole milk, divided 4 tablespoons white sugar 4 tablespoons cornstarch 1 teaspoon vanilla extract ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon, or more to taste Directions Bring water and rice to a boil in a saucepan. Immediately reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, uncovered and at a slow simmer, stirring occasionally, until soft and most of the water has been absorbed, about 30 minutes. Add 2 cups milk and sugar. Increase the heat to high and bring to a boil. Stir remaining 1/2 cup milk and cornstarch together in a bowl; add to boiling rice-milk mixture along with vanilla. Stir until well combined, then remove from the heat. Ladle into individual serving dishes and sprinkle with cinnamon. Let cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes, then refrigerate until well chilled, at least 4 hours. Add Your Photo Photos of Rizogalo (Greek Rice Pudding) 01 of 06 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 06 Photo by  craigjaneway 12/13/2021 03 of 06 Photo by  Savannah 08/13/2020 Super easy to make! Not too sweet, but still perfect for my sweet tooth! I like to add nutmeg and cinnamon as well. 04 of 06 Photo by  linda 02/20/2020 I really like this not too sweet dessert! I followed the recipe exactly except for one thing: I continued to cook the mixture for 1 minute after adding cornstarch to make sure it wouldn’t taste starchy. 05 of 06 Photo by  Carrington Williams 11/03/2019 1 You’ll Also Love Arroz con Leche (Mexican Rice Pudding) 34 Ratings Dairy-Free Coconut Rice Pudding 5 Ratings Instant Pot Vegan Rice Pudding 9 Ratings Sweet Rice 61 Ratings Chef John's Classic Rice Pudding 132 Ratings Fast Rice Pudding 117 Ratings Rachel's Creamy Rice Pudding 3 Ratings Authentic Italian Rice Pudding 9 Ratings Instant Pot Coconut-Orange Rice Pudding 3 Ratings Grandma's Rice Pudding 9 Ratings Arroz con Leche (Rice Pudding) 21 Ratings Best Old-Fashioned Creamy Rice Pudding 843 Ratings Crème Brûlée Rice Pudding Vegan Sweet Potato-Rice Pudding 1 Rating Chocolate Rice Pudding 18 Ratings Instant Pot® Old-Fashioned Rice Pudding 4 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Diana Moutsopoulos
instructions: Bring water and rice to a boil in a saucepan. Immediately reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, uncovered and at a slow simmer, stirring occasionally, until soft and most of the water has been absorbed, about 30 minutes.;Add 2 cups milk and sugar. Increase the heat to high and bring to a boil.;Stir remaining 1/2 cup milk and cornstarch together in a bowl; add to boiling rice-milk mixture along with vanilla. Stir until well combined, then remove from the heat.;Ladle into individual serving dishes and sprinkle with cinnamon. Let cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes, then refrigerate until well chilled, at least 4 hours.
